definition: to stabilize/to keep (prices, vermin etc) under control
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
to restrain/to restrict/to keep down/or

sentences.english: It comes amid concern about the possibility of fragmentation of rebel forces after toppling Col Gaddafi.
sentences.chinese: 此言是为了平抑大家对于卡倒台后义军分裂的忧虑。

sentences.english: At the same time arbitrage can surely smooth the price.
sentences.chinese: 但同时套利行为也无疑产生了重要的价格平抑作用。

sentences.english: Hence, we advanced several suggestions aimed at smoothening grain production fluctuation.
sentences.chinese: 并据此提出了平抑粮食生产波动的几点建议。

sentences.english: Such measures are the best long- and short-term policy response to high price levels.
sentences.chinese: 这些手段是平抑高物价最好的短期与长期政策。

definition: stable prices/commodity prices fixed by government (in a command economy)/to valorize (a commodity)
to regulate/to control
supply and demand
to furnish/to provide/supply (as in supply and demand)
supply and demand (economics)
to calm/to appease/to quieten
to supply/to provide/to offer
to relieve/to ease (pressure)/to alleviate/to remove/to get rid of
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
smooth/steady
to untie/(fig.) to ease restrictions
macro-control
to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
(economics) to reduce/to curtail/to cut back/to tighten/austerity/tightening/crunch
to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
